Admissions requirements

 NOTE: THESE ARE THE MINIMUM REQUIREMENT INTO MCGILL UNIVERSITY

  • This Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent as recognized by McGill University) subject is closely related to the one selected for a graduate’s work.
  • Note: if you have obtained any educational credentials at any of the institutions outside of Canada, they will be assessed for equivalency with a McGill University degree.
  • For more information visit the McGill campus.
  • please consult the international Degree Equivalency

Mcgill‘s Student high academic achievement:

Has a cumulative minimum Grade Points Average (CGPA) is 3.0 out of a possible 4.0, or a Grade Point Average (GPA) of 3.2 out of 4.0 this was scored two years ago of full-time studies.

  • In some departments,  a higher CGPA is required for admission. And you can as well Consult the program page for more details.

Proficiency English:

  • The primary language of instructions at McGill is the English language. You can also make arrangements to write examinations or theses in French.
  • In terms where there is knowledge of the English language one of the objectives of the course. To gain admission you will need to demonstrate an adequate level of proficiency in English.
  • To gather more pieces information, visit the English Language Proficiency

See Also>>> The SFU Undergraduate Scholars Entrance Scholarship

FACTORS TO CONSIDER TO GAIN ADMISSION:

Getting admission into graduate programs at McGill is very holistic, meaning that there are many factors taken into consideration in the admission decision, including academic credentials and grades. The new students must get the minimum requirements above to be considered for acceptance.

Note: getting the minimum admissions requirements does not guarantee your admission.

Getting Admission into graduate studies required high competitiveness and may as well depends on the admissions requirements of the academic unit and the availability of resources such as supervision, funding, laboratory space, class sizes, etc.

NOTE:  that to read the complete graduate admission policies, please refer to our Programs, Courses, and University Regulations guide.
